music.title: Nearly Invisible Stitches
music.author: Martux_M ft. Lymbic
music.description: Remix of Nils Petter Molvær’s track featuring Lymbic.

music.title: Aural Crave
music.author: Martux_M ft. Giulio Maresca
music.description: Written and produced alongside Giulio Maresca, "Aural Crave" is a fourteen-minute single showcasting melodic house experimentation.

music.title: Chainmode
music.author: Martux_M ft. Lymbic
music.description: Co-produced with Lymbic, the album offers a captivating journey through electronic vibes, solid grooves, esoteric arpeggios and wild synths, promising a cosmic adventure for the listener. The track “Drive your Cart” was featured in a BMW commercial.

music.title: Apollo 11 Reloaded
music.author: Martux_M ft. Giulio Maresca
music.description:
A collaborative project with Giulio Maresca, dedicated to the 50th anniversary of the moon landing, unfolds as a complete audiovisual experience. Featuring archival images from the Istituto Luce and the Italian Space Agency curated by Bruno Palma, the project premiered live on New Year’s Eve at the Festa di Roma.
The album itself embodies an electronic psychedelia, offering a musical odyssey that narrates the various stages of the Apollo 11 mission. From the departure in the opening track “Lift Off” to the return to Earth depicted in “Return,” the journey traverses the diverse realms of electronic music. Techno, dub, and ambient elements intermingle with melodic psychedelia, encapsulating the essence of the historic voyage.

music.title: My Love Supreme
music.author: Martux_M Crew ft. Francesco Bearzatti
music.description: A new jazz album presenting a tribute to John Coltrane's "A Love Supreme". Martux_M wanted to investigate the essence of Coltrane's masterpiece and felt the need to revisit the message of gratitude that inspired him. "My Love Supreme" is a celebration of a sacred universal love of this great artist.

music.title: Imagine
music.author: Martux_M Crew
music.description:
"Martux_M revisited jazz with an electronic reinterpretation of Miles Davis' iconic work.
While reading his biography, I was struck by the phrase ‘I have to constantly change, it's a curse.’ So I decided to reinterpret those compositions as if Miles were playing them today alongside artists like Jeff Mills or Carl Craig.”
- Martux_M in Indie for Bunnies interview

music.title: About In a Silent Way
music.author: Martux_M
music.description: With "About In a Silent Way", Martux_M returned to jazz after many years, but from a different perspective. The album is an electronic reinterpretation of Miles Davis' iconic work. While reading his biography, Martux_M was struck by the phrase: "I have to constantly change, it's a curse", which led him to reinterpret those compositions as if Miles were playing them today alongside artists like Jeff Mills or Carl Craig.

music.title: Reminiscence
music.author: Martux_M ft. Danilo Rea
music.description: Jazz and electronics come together in the album co-created with Danilo Rea. Original compositions and free improvisations, featuring the voices of Silvia Colombini and Gian Paolo Fiocchi, result in 12 tracks that transcend ambient music and contemporary classical.

music.title: Who is Playing on the Shadow of Whom
music.author: Dogon
